Authors:
Sheng-Hua Wu, Chia-Ling Wei, Yu-Ping CHEN, Che-Chih
Chen
Title:
Albocorticium gen. nov. (Hymenochaetales, Basidiomycota) with
three new species
Keywords:
China, corticioid fungi, multi-gene phylogeny, new genus,
Taiwan
Abstract:
The corticioid fungal new genus Albocorticium
(Hymenochaetales) is presented together with three new species: A.
magnosporum, A. mediosporum and A. parvisporum. Most collections of
these three species were made from Taiwan and a few specimens were
collected from mainland China. Taxonomic status of the new genus and new
species were supported by phylogenetic analyses of DNA sequences
inferred from a combined dataset of nuc rDNA 28S+5.8S genetic markers,
and a nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS) dataset. Bayesian, Maximum
Likelihood and Maximum Parsimony algorithms were used to construct
phylogenies of these two set of analyses. Basidiomes of Albocorticium
spp. are resupinate, effused; hymenial surface white or whitish cream,
smooth, minutely or strongly cracked; hyphal system is monomitic with
clamped hyphae, oily secreted material usually distributed in subiculum
and hymenial layer, cystidia are lacking while hyphidia are present,
clavate basidia, sterigmata fairly stout and rigid when young,
thin-walled basidiospores usually have a fairly prominent apiculus; all
microscopical elements are inamlyloid. These three new species can be
distinguished by having different basidiospore dimensions.
